page.title: 09SHAFTESBURY BOYS CLUB
page.content: This year{Shaftesbury Boys' Club}is celebrating its hundredth anniversary. It is open from 6-15pm on Monday to Friday. When you first join it is 50p and then every time you come a further 10p. Inside the club, there are a gym and rooms for games, television, art and computer. Outside, the club has a five-a-side court, two grass football pitches and a cricket pitch. Shaftesbury organises football teams in six different age groups from nine to eighteen, and enters the Wallasey Cup, Wirral League Cup and the Knockout Cup. They play matches on Sundays. At Easter the under twelves football team went to Belgium to play matches. They stayed with Belgian families. On Fridays they have judo. Sometimes the boys go camping to Wales.
